subject: Add FirmwareResiliency and FirmwareUpdateStatus
commitMessage:
Add FirmwareResiliency and FirmwareUpdateStatus

Panic word not suitable for Platform firmware resiliency events. Hence
add the following message registry for PFR events.
1. FirmwareResiliency for warning severity events.
2. FirmwareUpdateStatus for firmware update notifications with
OK severity.

These message registries are implemented in the following review.
https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/pfr-manager/+/47609

Tested:
Redfish Service Validator test passed for this change.

1. Update BMC firmware
POST: https://<BMC_IP>/redfish/v1/UpdateService/
      with <BMC_Update_Capsule> binary file
After BMC reboots check for Event log in Redfish
Command: GET: https://<BMC_IP>/redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/
              EventLog/Entries
Response:
{
    "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/
     EventLog/Entries/1618207226",
    "@odata.type": "#LogEntry.v1_8_0.LogEntry",
    "Created": "2021-04-12T06:00:26+00:00",
    "EntryType": "Event",
    "Id": "1618207226",
    "Message": "Firmware update occurred due to BMC update
     intent.",
    "MessageArgs": [
        "BMC update intent"
    ],
    "MessageId": "OpenBMC.0.2.FirmwareUpdateStatus",
    "Name": "System Event Log Entry",
    "Severity": "OK"
}
2. Reset BMC.
Command: ipmitool raw 6 2
After BMC reboots check for Event log in Redfish
Command: GET: https://<BMC_IP>/redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/
              EventLog/Entries
Response:
{
    "@odata.id": "/redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/
     EventLog/Entries/1618207249",
    "@odata.type": "#LogEntry.v1_8_0.LogEntry",
    "Created": "2021-04-12T06:02:49+00:00",
    "EntryType": "Event",
    "Id": "1618207249",
    "Message": "Firmware resiliency event occurred due to BMC
     reset detected.",
    "MessageArgs": [
        "BMC reset detected"
    ],
    "MessageId": "OpenBMC.0.2.FirmwareResiliency",
    "Name": "System Event Log Entry",
    "Severity": "Warning"
}

Signed-off-by: Chalapathi Venkataramashetty <chalapathix.venkataramashetty@intel.com>
Signed-off-by: Jayaprakash Mutyala <mutyalax.jayaprakash@intel.com>
Change-Id: I9c3231d1ef122d18e3deb44d62159bc5f0188e1d

(1 comment)

Thanks for this commit. Nitpick from https://chris.beams.io/posts/git-commit/
Limit the subject line to 50 characters
Updated the subject line. Thank You
Need this first
Latest Redfish Service Validator is having issues. working to fix soon.
resilience vs. resiliency. Pick one and stay consistent between the message name and description. I prefer "resilience" but they have the same meaning, AFAIK.
used resiliency as changes are minimal and aligns with MessageID in pfr-manager. Thank You
This formatting doesn't look correct
I think it's right - there are other entries formatted similarly. Just an oddity of clang-format logic.
This phrasing seems awkward - this is the "notification". How about just "Firmware resilience notification: %1".
Modified. Thank You

What are the issue? Is this specific to this change? If not, please update.
You can run redfish validator for specific sub node (/redfish/v1/Registries/OpenBMC) and make sure it is passed.  Other failure can be take as separate commit.
Redfish Validator passed. Thank You
Move this above the FirmwareResiliencyError i.e Line no: 466
as per Alphabetic order FirmwareResiliencyEvent comes after FirmwareResiliencyError. Thank You
Notification
Updated. Thank You

As Ed pointed out, I don't think we can remove item from the registry without a version bump. Removal might need a major version bump(?), so these should probably be left in place to avoid that, and then just do a minor version bump to account for the other messages that are reworded.
These messages are left as it is. Thank You
You can't make any changes to the registry without a version bump.  That's why the version exists 😊
Yes, In the latest patch set, we are not removing existing entries.
Is there really no resolution? AC cycle? Reflash?
BMC recovers and boot up with recovery version. Hence no resolution is required. Thank You

"Notification" on this enum is redundant, and implies the delivery of this message, which might not be a notification.  Same thing with "Event" in the previous definition.  We are in the EventLog, all of these are "Events".   Lets be consistent and leave it off.
Updated the message IDs to FirmwareResiliency for resiliency warning events and FirmwareUpdateStatus to indicate the update intent events after firmware update.

This is not how these messages are generally formatted.  Once the parameter is filled in, the message should read like a normal sentence.

"Firmware resiliency has failed for device %d"

Would be an example of how to structure this.  Generally the individual parameters are a single word, not a whole log message in-themselves.  I suspect that these need broken out into a few more message types for your use case, but I don't really know all the types of messages these might have, so I can only speculate.


For example, if I wanted to match on a firmware failing to read, in Redfish I should be able to do that without looking at the message string itself.
Reframed the message to "Firmware update occurred due to %1."
Why is it a warning that the BMC reset? Doesn't seem like the right way to report this event.
Hello Ed, I request you to review this change and provide your comments. Thank You
Still need to add a version bump

I've pointed out a versioning comment that has been ignored on two subsequent patches.  This is the same issue that Jonathan has pointed out in his last comment.
Ack
Ack
I hope Versioning comment is fixed by changing value "0.2.0" to "0.3.0". Please suggest if this is not expected. I have fixed all the comments now. Please review and provide me if any other comments.

Apologies for this. Till now we did not changed related to versioning. So not clear about the expectation. I hope Versioning comment is fixed by changing value "0.2.0" to "0.3.0". Please suggest if this is not expected. 

And even I have formatted the event messages in alphabetical order.
Hi Ed, Requesting you to review and confirm the changes. Thanks

Hi Ed, please review patch. Please let us know if still need to change version on this patch as well.
Thanks.
